@MikeDSykes this reminded me of one my favorite ever tweets on here https://t.co/p0CEaJFhTD
@clob9444 @xeni and yet u can't cite a single source and think non-citizens account for 35% of HC $$. laughable. i'm moving on, bye now
@clob9444 @xeni businesses have bottom lines that they rigorously study. you should try it sometime
@clob9444 @xeni you do realize that any working non-citizen in the US pays medicare taxes right?
@clob9444 @xeni yes, that is also inhumane
@clob9444 @xeni if you want to understand actual research on health care cost factors, i suggest you start here https://t.co/hvdNck81OV
@clob9444 @xeni 25-35%? i can't deal with an "economist" who just makes up numbers
@clob9444 @xeni not only is turning away non-citizens inhumane, its counterproductive. preventive care is cheaper then ER. cover everyone
@clob9444 @xeni a monopoly is a market w/one seller. i'm referring to a market w/one buyer, or monopsony. refer back to my first graph
@clob9444 @xeni yes, so reduce the waste via creating a buyer monopoly in the HC market. also, total costs? lol
@clob9444 @xeni single payer system would raise taxes but also eliminate all private insurance premiums, so net positive for 95% of people
@clob9444 @xeni the solution is to reduce their market power, in this case via monopsony - only allow 1 buyer (gov't) in market
@clob9444 @xeni the #1 factor associated with high HC spending in the US is the market power of doctors, pharma, and hospitals
@clob9444 @xeni you are an economist unfamiliar with OECD data on public expenditures? https://t.co/i6xkEHfbAZ
@clob9444 @xeni full coverage with one single payer of all medical bills would give us tools to radically lower costs, not increase them
@clob9444 @xeni the way to stop hospitals (& pharma & doctors) from jacking up prices is to have one single payer that negotiates the prices
@clob9444 @xeni you are right that uninsured people using ER is expensive but the solution is access to primary care via insurance coverage
@clob9444 @xeni wrong again. we spend way less on social welfare than many developed countries and the ways in which we do are dumb
@clob9444 @xeni the taxes you'd pay for single payer healthcare would be much less than premiums paid by you or your employer right now
@clob9444 @xeni buddy, we spend way more than any European country on health care and have much worse results https://t.co/may5huYxGh
@clob9444 @xeni all those canadians, japanese, and europeans with single payer systems would beg to differ
@VanHorn12 @KiranOpal @latimes i'm saying the safety excuse is a crock and the 21st century cures act shows it
